sen.j: 室大墓古墳（むろのおおばかこふん）は、奈良県御所市に所在する古墳時代中期前半の前方後円墳である。
sen.e: The Muro no Obaka tumulus is a keyhole-shaped tumulus, located in Gose City, Nara Prefecture, which was constructed in the first half of the middle era of the kofun period (tumulus period).
The Muro no Obaka tumulus is a keyhole-shaped tumulus, located in Gose City, Nara Prefecture, which was constructed in the first half of the middle era of the kofun period (tumulus period).
The Muro no Obaka tumulus is a keyhole-shaped tumulus, located in Gose City, Nara Prefecture, which was constructed in the first half of the middle era of the kofun period (tumulus period).

sen.j: 「宮山（みややま）古墳」、「室宮山古墳」とも言う。
sen.e: It is also called "the Miyayama tumulus" or "the Muromiyayama tumulus."
It is also called 'the Miyayama tumulus' or 'the Muromiyayama tumulus.'
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。
sen.e: It is also called 'the Miyayama tumulus' or 'the Muromiyayama tumulus.'
The length of the tumulus is 238 m.
The length of the tumulus is 238 m.
The length of the tumulus is 238 m.

sen.j: 後円部上に立てられた靫（ゆぎ）埴輪は高さ147cm、最大幅99.5cmある。
sen.e: The haniwa (unglazed terra-cotta cylinders and hollow sculptures arranged on and around the mounded tombs (kofun)) for a quiver placed on the round part of the tumulus is 147 cm in height and 99.5 cm max. in width.

The haniwa (unglazed terra-cotta cylinders and hollow sculptures arranged on and around the mounded tombs [kofun]) for a quiver placed on the round part of the tumulus is 147cm in height and max. 99.5cm in width.
sen.cmt: 括弧内括弧を［］に訂正しました。max.の位置を訂正しました。
sen.e: The haniwa (unglazed terra-cotta cylinders and hollow sculptures arranged on and around the mounded tombs [kofun]) for a quiver placed on the round part of the tumulus is 147cm in height and max. 99.5cm in width.
The location
The location
The location

sen.j: 天井石に石棺と同質の黄土色の流紋岩質溶結凝灰岩が使用され、壁石には緑泥石片岩、石墨片岩などの結晶片岩が使われている。
sen.e: For the stones for the ceiling, ocher rhyolitic welded tuff is used, and crystalline schist, such as chlorite schist and graphite schist, is used for the stones for the walls.
For the stones for the ceiling, ocher rhyolitic welded tuff is used, and crystalline schist, such as chlorite schist and graphite schist, is used for the stones for the walls.
For the stones for the ceiling, ocher rhyolitic welded tuff is used, and crystalline schist, such as chlorite schist and graphite schist, is used for the stones for the walls.

sen.j: 結晶片岩は紀の川の岩石であり、流紋岩質溶結凝灰岩は、兵庫県加古川市付近に広く分布する姫路酸性岩と呼ばれている溶結凝灰岩である。
sen.e: The crystalline schist is rocks and stones in the Kino-kawa River, and the rhyolitic welded tuff is welded tuff called Himeji acidic rocks widely available in Kakogawa City and its vicinity of Hyogo Prefecture.

The crystalline schist is rocks and stones in the Kino-kawa River, and the rhyolitic welded tuff is welded tuff called Himeji acidic rocks widely available in Kakogawa City and its vicinity of Hyogo Prefecture.
